Articles.Content:
I bought the game yesterday and so far I am really enjoying it, but I went to continue today and now its locking up etc. After searching I found this thread but I am a little lost, if someone could help me I would really appreciate it.

My Save is http://pastebin.com/4SQecc1t

Thanks

Moved to it's own thread, as your save file indicates a shows it's not the firing Kerbals bug.

Welcome to the forums!

Please read the Stock Support & Bug Reporting Guide, as there's not enough information in your post to help.

I do apologize hope this is a better request !

KSP Version; build id = 007052014-12-15_13-42-05

Branch: master

After starting up KSP I proceed to click on the different buildings but nothing happens, the only building I can go in is Mission Control. Once I exit back to the Space station view it locks and I have to Task manager and quit.

Screenshot; http://i.imgur.com/CJAa2R8.png ( Notice in the top right hand corner, multiple screens ! )

Save file; http://pastebin.com/4SQecc1t

System Information

------------------

Operating System: Windows 7 Professional 64-bit (6.1, Build 7601) Service Pack 1 (7601.win7sp1_gdr.140303-2144)

Language: English (Regional Setting: English)

System Manufacturer: Gigabyte Technology Co., Ltd.

System Model: H81M-H

BIOS: BIOS Date: 01/20/14 10:47:47 Ver: 04.06.05

Processor: Intel® Core i5-4670 CPU @ 3.40GHz (4 CPUs), ~3.4GHz

Memory: 8192MB RAM

Available OS Memory: 8084MB RAM

Page File: 6221MB used, 9945MB available

Windows Dir: C:\Windows

DirectX Version: DirectX 11

DX Setup Parameters: Not found

User DPI Setting: Using System DPI

System DPI Setting: 96 DPI (100 percent)

DWM DPI Scaling: Disabled

DxDiag Version: 6.01.7601.17514 32bit Unicode

Thanks.

Edited January 8, 2015 by The Dad Gamer

Hello!

Well, your picture is entirely consistent with the "can't fire a kerbal" bug shown here: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/105651-FIX-KSC-Buildings-Lock-Up-Can-t-Click-on-Anything-Firing-Kerbal-Crashes-Game

However, I looked through your save file and didn't see any problems so I went ahead and loaded it in my KSP. It loaded up fine and I was able to click on the buildings.

Did you grab the correct save file when you uploaded? Or did you do anything immediately after saving? This bug is usually triggered by firing a kerbal that has logged an achievement or that you rescued from orbit. Specifically, you have Jeb who logged first flight. If you were to fire him, your game will lock up.

Welcome to the forums!

Cheers,

~Claw

Thank you for the quick reply, I have looked into my saves and there is two more 'quicksaves' one called quicksave.sfs and the other is called quicksave#1.sfs, this is the latter; http://pastebin.com/dazvTgz8

Thanks

Why quicksaves? Shouldn't we be looking at the persistent.sfs file? If you're loading up your save file and this is occurring, the error ought to be in the persistence file. A cursory glance at that quicksave also shows no obvious issues.

Yes, the persistence is the one that is likely broken. Given what I'm hearing now, I would say the directions in the thread linked below should solve your problem.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/105651-FIX-KSC-Buildings-Lock-Up-Can-t-Click-on-Anything-Firing-Kerbal-Crashes-Game

Cheers,

~Claw
